metadata.name: Stop Windows Service Via PowerShell Stop-Service
metadata.comment: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the PowerShell Cmdlet "Stop-Service"

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('2') AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('powershell\.exe', 'pwsh\.dll')) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('stop-service ')))

output.summary: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the PowerShell Cmdlet "Stop-Service"

metadata.objective: False positive: There are many legitimate reasons to stop a service. This rule isn't looking for any suspicious behaviour in particular. Filter legitimate activity accordingly Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.management/stop-service?view=powershell-7.4
